–í–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã –ø–æ –≤–∞–∫–∞–Ω—Å–∏—è–º –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –∑–∞–¥–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å –º–Ω–µ –≤ –ª–∏—á–∫—É. –¢–∞–∫–∂–µ –±—É–¥—É –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä–µ–Ω –µ—Å–ª–∏ –ø–æ–¥–∫–∏–Ω–∏—Ç–µ –∫—Ä—É—Ç—ã—Ö –∫–∞–Ω–¥–∏–∞—Ç–æ–≤, –∏–ª–∏ –ø–æ—à–∞—Ä–∏—Ç–µ / –ø–æ–ª–∞–π–∫–∞–π—Ç–µ –º–æ–π LinkedIn –ø–æ—Å—Ç.

–í—Å–µ–º –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç! –ú—ã –≤ InTone —Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞ –Ω–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ–º, –ø–∏—à–∏—Ç–µ, –±—É–¥—É —Ä–∞–¥ –ø–æ–æ–±—â–∞—Ç—å—Å—è)

Position: Backend Engineer (Middle+ / Senior)
Compensation: $50-70k / year + stock options
Remote (relocation package available)

InTone created a voice processing technology that enhances accents in real time. Our mission is to enable seamless communication between people from different cultures. We are backed by Berkeley SkyDeck, Yellow Rocks Capital and angels with major exits in AI and BPO areas.

We built a unique machine learning pipeline and moved voice tech from 2s+ latencies to less than 300ms. You can use our application for Zoom calls, and our clients are international call centers.

As a member of our fast-paced team, you will¬†have the unique opportunity to work with technology that will be used by millions of people every day. You must be passionate about building things, good engineering practices and solving complex challenges.

In this role you will:
- develop desktop and cloud components of the InTone app
- integrate virtual microphone driver
- manage deployment process
- assist ML team with integrating ML models

Looking for experience in:
- C++ / Python
- Building cloud services architecture (e.g. on AWS/GCloud)

Bonus points:
- Windows Drivers
- Performance optimization
- Audio stream processing
- PyTorch / ONNX
- Electron.js / React

We offer:
- Working with state-of-the-art technology
- Leading a project in an environment of the Bay Area startup
- Our network to connect with experts in any area
- Stock options on at the level of the first employees
- Relocation package

Reach out to andrew@intone.io or telegram:@andrewgolman. We would love to tell you more and answer the questions. Join us in deploying state-of-the-art Speech AI to the world!

# –≤–∞–∫–∞–Ω—Å–∏—è

Position: Middle / Senior Data Scientist

Company: Deep Knowledge Group (https://www.dkv.global/)

Work mode: contract, fully remote

Salary: ‚Ç¨2k - ‚Ç¨3.5k for middle, ‚Ç¨3k - ‚Ç¨4.5k for senior

Description: 
Deep Knowledge Group, a data-driven investment fund focused on young companies developing frontier technologies, is looking for talented data scientists with a solid mathematical background and desire to work in an international environment, solve challenging problems and find creative solutions.
  
Responsibilities: 
- Data collection from open sources, preprocessing, systematization and storage in a proprietary database.
- Evaluating the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data collection methods.
- Developing processes and tools to cross validate data.
- Developing custom data models and forecasting algorithms and their validation.
- Work closely with other teams to monitor the quality of models implementation for the commercial use.
- Documentation and reports preparation for clients and management.

Qualifications:
- Master or higher degree in Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Finance, Computer Science or another quantitative field.
- Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on research product development.
- Experience working with and creating data architectures.
- Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
- Advanced knowledge of Python (SciPy, Numpy, Pandas, TensorFlow), experience in NLP.
- Good knowledge of statistics: statistical tests, distributions, univariate/multivariate regressions, time series analysis methods.
- Good written and verbal English for coordinating across teams and reports preparation.
- Desire to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
- Knowledge of quantitative finance / econometrics is a strong plus.

We offer: fast career growth for high performing workers and challenging tasks.

Send your CV to: @nickenote (telegram) or n.bersenev@dkv.global

Position:
PhD

Location:
Delft University of Technology (TU Delft), Nitherlands

Format:
On-site, full-time (36‚Äî40 hours per week)

Salary: 
‚Ç¨2325‚Äî‚Ç¨2972 / month

Description:
We are looking for a doctoral student to work on the modelling of multi-scale, multi-physics systems for the generation and detection of THz radiation. THz technology has important applications in wireless communications and imaging in for example medicine and security. You will work on the design of efficient and accurate boundary element methods and finite element methods with special focus on the inclusion of non-linearities and the use of domain decomposition methods. You will work on the formulation of physical processes as mathematical problems, the design of numerical methods for their approximate solution, and the implementation of those methods on modern high performance computing infrastructure. You will collaborate with colleagues in different disciplines across mathematics, engineering, and computer science at different international institutes.
This position is for 6 years with a 30% teaching load. In special cases the teaching load can be reduced to 15% for a 4 year period.

Company: 
TU Delft, Department of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science

Contacts:
k.cools@tudelft.nl
Kristof Cools, assistant professor

https://www.academictransfer.com/en/290845/phd-in-computational-electromagnetics/

Application deadline:
April 30
